title: Travel
text:
The closest airport to the wedding venue is Portland International Airport (PDX). It is a one-hour drive from the airport to Hood River, and a further 20 minutes to the wedding venue.

Flights into Portland
We recommend that you book your flights early. Oregon is a big tourist destination in the Summer, and flights can get expensive, or “spendy” as the locals might say.

JetBlue and Alaska Airlines offer direct flights from Boston Logan to PDX.
If you are flying from across the pond, there are direct flights to PDX from London Heathrow, Amsterdam, Frankfurt, and Keflavik, Iceland. There are also direct flights from Dublin to some other West Coast cities, including an Aer Lingus route to Seattle.
Are you looking for a deal? We recommend checking first for connecting flights through bigger West Coast hubs like Los Angeles (LAX), San Francisco, Seattle, or Vancouver, BC.



From Portland to Hood River
Renting a car offers you the most convenience, but if you would like to avoid renting a car you have some options.


From Hood River to the venue
We will be offering shuttles from the Holiday Inn and the Hood River Hotel.

title: Frequently asked questions
text:
Can I bring my children to the wedding?
Do you have a tiny little baby? Under 1 year old? Please bring the baby if you’d like. Let us know when you RSVP.
Due to the limited capacity of the venue we are unable to accommodate older children at our event.
For out of town guests, we have hired a babysitter! She is lovely and she is also a kindergarten teacher! Her name is Maddie. She would love to watch your child while you enjoy the ceremony and eat your dinner and longer if needed. Please email us (siobhankyle2016@gmail.com) if you are interested in this!


Can I bring a guest or plus-one?
Due to limited event space, only the adults listed on the invitation will be able to attend.


What is the setting of the wedding?
The wedding will be outside in an orchard. The ceremony and cocktail hour will be in full sun, but we will have fans and some parasols. We recommend sunscreen!


What else should we know about the venue?
The bathrooms are in mobile trailers!
There is another venue called The Orchard nearby. We are not getting married there! We are at Mt. View Orchards.


What is the dress code?
Semi-formal. Color recommended! Do you have a linen or seersucker suit you’ve always wanted to wear? Now’s the time. No ties are necessary, at the groom’s request.
Please avoid colors traditionally reserved for the bride, like white and ivory.


Where can I park?
There is ample parking at the venue. When you take the turn off of Trout Creek road toward the venue, keep going past the left turn that would take you into the venue and head to the big parking lot and park there!


How can I get to the wedding?
If you are staying at either of the hotels we have a room block at, a shuttle will pick you up if you like. You can also, of course, drive from wherever you are coming from!


What time should I arrive to the wedding?
Doors open at 3 pm and the bar will be open. Come and enjoy a cocktail with the bride and groom before the ceremony!
The ceremony will begin promptly at 4pm.

Other options
Hampton Inn and Suites: Two-night minimum, starting at $335/night.
Best Western Plus Hood River Inn: These rooms open to the general public 60 days before the stay (e.g., May 19, 2025). Until then the rooms are reserved for guests who have events at the hotel.
Society Hotel Bingen: We love this hotel and spa! They have a variety of rooms: cabins, bunks, rooms with patios. The spa and bathhouse are amazing! It is on the Washington state side of the Columbia river. Slightly less convenient to get to the wedding but a great hotel nonetheless!
AirBnb, VRBO, and Booking.com all have houses available to rent in the area. We would recommend staying in Hood River for convenience. White Salmon, WA also has great options and is cheaper. You will need to drive across the Hood River Bridge to get to the Oregon side. There is $3.50 toll each way.
Also if you’re looking for a cheaper option, you can camp!

title: Things to do
text:
Hood River and the Columbia River Gorge
Hood River is a noted kiteboarding destination nestled between Mt. Hood and Mt. Adams in the Columbia River Gorge.
To get there from Portland, we recommend taking the Historic Columbia River Highway.
The Best Man’s guide to the Gorge


Are you staying a little bit longer?
Are you a golfer? We aren’t. But our more golfing-inclined friends love the Bandon Dunes Golf Resort, which features breathtaking views of the Pacific. The drive from Hood River takes 4-5 hours and offers some gorgeous destinations along the way—don’t miss the 10 waterfalls at Silver Falls State Park. You can also fly into Southwest Oregon Regional Airport (OTH) in North Bend, a 30 minute drive from Bandon, from either Denver or San Francisco.


Cities we love

Portland (here’s a map)

Don’t miss the International Rose Test Garden at Washington Park

Astoria (coastal, breweries, shipwreck in Fort Stevens State Park)
Cannon Beach (Oregon Coast, Haystack Rock)
Pacific City (Oregon Coast, Dunes, Pacific City Brewing, firepits on the beach)
Bend (Central Oregon, high desert, amazing outdoor recreation, most breweries per capita in the US)

title: Shuttles
text:
We recommend that you take the earliest shuttle you can. Why?

The party starts when you get there! Translation: open bar.
The ceremony starts promptly at 4pm.

Shuttles will start at the Holiday Inn and then pick up more guests at the Hood River Hotel as space allows. The route follows winding country roads, so if you are sensitive to that please take precautions. You should expect a 25 minute ride from Hood River to the venue.

From the Holiday Inn Express

1:50pm pickup: 56 passenger motorcoach
2:20pm pickup: 14 passenger van



From the Hood River Hotel

2:10pm pickup: 56 passenger motorcoach
2:35pm pickup: 14 passenger van
3:20pm pickup: 56 passenger motorcoach

This final pickup may be skipped if all guests are already at the wedding!




From the wedding to Hood River

7:15pm early pickup (wedding ends at 9pm): 56-passenger motorcoach
8:45pm pickup: Shuttles will be ready to take you to the AFTER PARTY at the Oak Street Pub, the Holiday Inn Express, or the Hood River Hotel



Getting home from the after party
Matty Green has a Pedicab and Taxi service that runs until at least 1am. He is inexpensive for local trips and you can call or text for rides (541-714-3130 for pedicab, 541-645-0667 for taxi).
Other taxi companies include:

Gorge Taxi (541-399-5060)
Designated Driver Taxi (509-281-0434)
Gorge PDX Shuttle (541-800-2028)

Uber and Lyft do not service Hood River.
